channel.title: Explosion effects
channel.description: I was thinking that the effects for explosions look a little... bland at the moment. They're pretty much just oversized sparks. Now this looks fine for grenade explosions, but it's unrealistic for explosive barrels etc. I think it would look much better if for the explosive barrels, satchel packs and rocket explosions (basically any oily sort of explosions) there was a fireball, like in the original Half-Life. Grenades and tripmines could keep the default Half-Life 2 style explosions because they spray shrapnel everywhere.

item.title: Explosion effects
item.dc:creator: RabidMonkey
item.description:
Great bump, guys.

Explosions in the mod will probably stay the way they are; similar to HL2’s default explosions. We will also utilize custom particles in some areas as necessary depending on what is exploding/catching on fire.

Read full topic

item.description:
I love KF(Killing Floor) blow up effect, some many smoke.

But realistic is better.

Read full topic

item.title: Explosion effects
item.dc:creator: Losmoges
item.description:
TheeGoatPig:

I can’t stand Hollywood fireball explosions. I would rather see more realistic HE explosions with just a fwoomp of dust and shock waves pushing out from the middle.

Indeed.

And about the explosive barrels, who says it’s oil?
Might be gas. Gas explodes fast.
Take this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BK3tZuodrjI
Clearly 2 stages in the explosion.

It’s possible to make it more dramatic, but I think it’s fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Explosion effects
item.dc:creator: Pokemon_Eater
item.description:
Coozins:

Well, the MK II grenades and tripmines mainly use shrapnel to do damage. I couldn’t really think of a better word for the explosions from satchel and rockets, but when they explode in real life they make fireballs.

The only explosives in Half_life that would make fireballs are satchels and the MK3A2 grenades in HL2 since those are filled with TNT or C4, not small amounts of explosive for a shrapnel or directed plasma jets for taking out tanks. Not that they probably would form a fireball since the gasses from the explosion aren’t made of gasoline aerosols as Gato said.

Read full topic

item.title: Explosion effects
item.dc:creator: Coozins
item.description:
Atomic Waffle:

No, they don’t.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xdbcacasmU8

In fact, the grenades and rockets and satchels in Half-Life and Half-Life 2 seemed quite a bit more powerful than conventional grenades, albeit without realistic shrapnel effects. That’s to be expected though, it’s a game.

The explosions should be violent, messy, bright, loud, and fiery, if only for the purpose of our amusement at blowing things to little giblits.

I didn’t mean the grenades make fireballs, I meant rockets.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gNHFe5Xqn-Y

I was saying that grenades should have the old explosion effects and rockets should have a fireball.

Read full topic

item.title: Explosion effects
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
Mr.Shadow:

nothing is disgusting about videogame gore. In fact it’s quite beautyfull to see realistic gore so you can enjoy almost real life gore without needing to kill/dig up people from the grave.

Gah, I can’t stand realistic gore. I can stand game gore, cheesy movie gore, but when it starts getting uber realstic/parts of the body are actually cut off with realistic blood and gore, I can’t watch. :fffuuu:
If game gore ever gets to the point when it’s completely anatomically correct and looks like real life, I’ll stop playing games with gibs. (Of course, we probably don’t have to worry about that, because if they got that realistic, the games would have characters with uncanny valley)

Read full topic
